text:
Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother,
To Philemon our beloved fellow worker
speaker: Narrator

text: and Apphia our sister and Archippus our fellow soldier, and the church in your house:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God always when I remember you in my prayers,
speaker: Narrator

text: because I hear of your love and of the faith that you have towards the Lord Jesus and for all the saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective for the full knowledge of every good thing that is in us for the sake of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have derived much joy and comfort from your love, my brother, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accordingly, though I am bold enough in Christ to command you to do what is required,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet for love's sake I prefer to appeal to you—I, Paul, an old man and now a prisoner also for Christ Jesus—
speaker: Narrator

text: I appeal to you for my child, Onesimus, whose father I became in my imprisonment.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Formerly he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful to you and to me.)
speaker: Narrator

text: I am sending him back to you, sending my very heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would have been glad to keep him with me, in order that he might serve me on your behalf during my imprisonment for the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I preferred to do nothing without your consent in order that your goodness might not be by compulsion but of your own accord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this perhaps is why he was parted from you for a while, that you might have him back for ever,
speaker: Narrator

text: no longer as a slave but more than a slave, as a beloved brother—especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if you consider me your partner, receive him as you would receive me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has wronged you at all, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it—to say nothing of your owing me even your own self.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, brother, I want some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time, prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping that through your prayers I will be graciously given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
speaker: Narrator
